title: The Stone House Legacy
description: Tessa Kingsley grows up as the only daughter of working-class parents. She attends a year of college, then marries a charismatic young minister with a vision of tolerance. She's a devoted wife and mother until her husband runs afoul of the John Birch Society because of his active role in the Civil Rights Movement.Their enemies will do anything to keep things the way they want them, including lies, corruption, and murder. The pressure builds for them to abandon their life in the ministry.Set in the birthplace of the John Birch Society during the turbulent years of the early 1960’s, The Stone House Legacy, reveals mankind’s stubborn inclination to repeat the mistakes of past generations. It is a fast-moving tale of youthful idealism in conflict with mid-western isolationism against a backdrop of fear and greed."...sure to stir emotions." - Bobby Underwood."... a "page-turner" that will have the reader waiting impatiently to discover the upcoming experiences of the Kingsley family in Book 2 - The Steel Canyon."
author: Wanda Dehaven Pyle
